intro: Hybanthus enneaspermus var. tsavoensis, commonly known as the Tsavo hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain multiple seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its harsh habitat.
